channel.title: Terrible headaches
channel.description: Lately, I've been having some serious issues with headaches, which usually affects my ability/desire to do something that requires either physical or mental exertion. The problem usually starts after working out or getting out of school, and I'm not really sure why this is a problem. I was wondering if anyone else has constant headaches, and if so, what do you do to prevent or limit them? Also, this isn't a problem "every now and then", but it has become a daily issue.

item.title: Terrible headaches
item.dc:creator: @asyo4 asyo4
item.description:
@asyo4 wrote:

try taking tylenol

Read full topic

item.title: Terrible headaches
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

Could be a variety of things. If you’re like the average computer nerd(power user? rofl), then you probably have a shitty ass diet. Make sure you get lots of veggies/fruits(mainly veggies) along with all your other food groups. Also, on that note, I’m pretty sure food allergies can give you headaches. Like other people said as well, it could be your vision. I had a friend that would get terrible headaches for months and would puke because of it. Then he went and got classes and now he’s perfectly fine. 7 hours of sleep actually isn’t enough. If you look at some studies, there are a lot of health problems associated with getting less than 8 hours, becoming more severe the farther you get from 8. Most of the people in my family sleep 10 hours or more a day, and on average live to be about 85. And of course, drink water and maybe get some exercise a little.

Read full topic

item.title: Terrible headaches
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:17, topic:527715”]Sleep 8 hours a day
Eat all 3 meals of the day
Drink about 4 glasses of water. 1 in the morning, 2 during the day, and 1 about an hour before you go to sleep.[/quote]

You’re suppose to be drinking like 8-12.

Read full topic

item.title: Terrible headaches
item.dc:creator: @Coldmedicine Coldmedicine
item.description:
@Coldmedicine wrote:

I really think you need glasses, i have glasses myself (just for reading)

And before i got these, i had terrible headaches, like a booming sound in the middle of my head,
First i thought i had cancer xD

but uhm, go see an eye-doctor, idk what its called in english,
Good luck!

Read full topic

item.title: Terrible headaches
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

I used to get headaches so bad that I was unable to move. I had to lay down in complete darkness with a pillow over my face to stop it from hurting, since the light makes it 100x worse.

Drinking lots of water and staying out of the sun for long periods of time usually worked, though. It’s still a good idea to see a doctor about it, it could be something serious.

Read full topic

item.title: Terrible headaches
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:19, topic:527715”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=646468.msg4347736#msg4347736 date=1376153684]
Could be a great deal associated with your eyes. Look in to seeing a doctor.
[/quote]
I have had some eye problems in the past year, such as not being able to see things clearly from a distance.[/quote]

Vain_:

You may want to go see a doctor. I use to have terrible migraines which were caused by bright lights and shit due to my vision sucking.

This he brings up a good point. Not only light though there is this called your “eye pressure” if it gets too high your head will hurt and if it gets too low your eye will be kind of “soft” and I think you can have an “eyeache” or something like that.

I know I have these issues and I have to like take some drops called “Alphagan P” and “Cosopt”

Read full topic

item.title: Terrible headaches
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:8, topic:527715”]Just sit there, in a comfortable resting position (sitting position not lying there) and just think about nothing or try to
Just relax, turn on some nature music so you can think about a waterfall Idk
just look up some guides. I dont do it much but i have done it and it sorta works when you are stressed[/quote]
This is a bunch of bull shit and wont help a bit with his situation. I use to get the same problem and it was either stress from school or not keeping hydrated. If school stresses you out then find a good reason to go to school in a good mood. Walk around and get to know a few people, pull pranks or something. Anything that is socially entertaining that will help you enjoy school. Also another problem was stuffy and warm air in class, if you get a warm stuffy sense in class then just ask the teacher to open windows and/or door, fresh air is always good to feed your respiratory system.

Read full topic

MEDITATE CUS U NEED TO MEDITATE
or take advil[/quote]
